intro: Themistoclesia pendula, commonly known as the hanging lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its pendulous, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, while its flowers are trumpet-shaped with five petals. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, shiny seeds.
